BusinessUnit.title: BusinessUnit
BusinessUnit.description: Represents a business unit within the Shetue Group.

id.description: Unique identifier for the BusinessUnit entity.

name.description: The canonical name of the business unit (e.g., Setu Filling Station).

aliases.description: An array of alternative names or aliases for the business unit (e.g., ["fuel station", "the pump"]

Metric.title: Metric
Metric.description: Represents a metric that is tracked for a specific business unit.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Metric entity.

name.description: The canonical name of the metric (e.g., daily_sales).

aliases.description: An array of alternative names or aliases for the metric.

Dashboard.title: Dashboard
Dashboard.description: Represents a customized dashboard configuration for a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Dashboard entity.

name.description: The name of the dashboard (e.g., Fuel Dashboard).

layout.description: The layout configuration of the dashboard (e.g., grid-auto).

Widget.title: Widget
Widget.description: Represents a widget on a dashboard displaying a specific metric.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Widget entity.

visualization.description: The type of visualization for the widget (e.g., line, bar).

timeframeType.description: The type of timeframe for the widget (e.g., relative, absolute).

timeframeStart.description: The start date for the widget timeframe if timeframeType is absolute.

timeframeEnd.description: The end date for the widget timeframe if timeframeType is absolute.

timeframePeriod.description: The period for the widget timeframe if timeframeType is relative (e.g., past_7d).

Alert.title: Alert
Alert.description: Represents an alert rule that triggers when a metric meets a specific condition.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Alert entity.

conditionOperator.description: The operator for the alert condition (e.g., <, >, ==).

conditionValue.description: The value for the alert condition.

durationMinutes.description: The duration in minutes for which the condition must be met before triggering the alert.

notifyChannels.description: An array of notification channels for the alert (e.g., ["telegram", "email"]

severity.description: The severity level of the alert (e.g., low, medium, high).

preferredLanguage.description: The user's preferred language (e.g., en, bn).

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to ensure Authorization Independence, support QAPs, and maintain data clarity. It leverages path-based ownership for user-specific data (dashboards) and segregates data with different access requirements. The structure denormalizes authorization data to avoid using `get()` calls in security rules.

**Authorization Independence:**
Authorization Independence is achieved through path-based ownership and avoids hierarchical authorization dependencies. The collaborative access to `BusinessUnit` data is managed by dedicated subcollections to avoid get() calls.

**QAPs Support:**
QAPs are supported through structural segregation and the membership model. User-owned dashboards are stored under the `/users/{userId}` collection, ensuring that listing dashboards is secure and limited to the user's data. Business Units have a flat structure.

**Structure Explanation:**
- `/users/{userId}`: Contains user-specific data, such as dashboards. This path enforces ownership.
- `/users/{userId}/dashboards/{dashboardId}`: Stores dashboard configurations for each user. The `userId` in the path ensures that only the owner can access the dashboards.
- `/business_units/{businessUnitId}`: Contains business unit data.
- `/business_units/{businessUnitId}/metrics/{metricId}`: Contains metrics data for a business unit.
- `/business_units/{businessUnitId}/widgets/{widgetId}`: Contains widgets data for a business unit. The `businessUnitId` in the path ensures that only authorized users can access the widgets.
- `/business_units/{businessUnitId}/alerts/{alertId}`: Contains alerts data for a business unit. The `businessUnitId` in the path ensures that only authorized users can access the alerts.
